section.p: This file represents the sales of a company over the years 2007-2015.

ol.li: Create a chart showing the sales against the year.
Add the following trend lines in succession: linear, logarithmic and exponentiall.Display for each of these trend lines the R-squared value. Choose the most appropriate trend line.
Make a forecast of the sales for 2016 through the options for the trend line and read the value in the chart.
Calculate a more accurate prediction with a worksheet formula.
Experiment with the trend line options to figure out when a revenue of $ 25,000,000 is expected.

section.title: Solution
section.p: The exponential trend line has the highest R-squared value and is the best choice.
Forecast for 2016, read from the chart: about $ 20,000,000
Because the best trend line is exponential you can use the function GROWTH. =GROWTH(B2:B10,A2:A10,A11) gives $20,000,000.
In the trendline options the number of forward periods opties has to be set on 3 to get a forecast > 25,000,000. This will be expected somewhere in 2018.
